Executing a Report

When you click the VIEW button, BusinessIQ will begin executing the instructions in the report definition. BIQ translates the report definition as it is represented on the screen into a specific set of instructions for how it should interrogate the database and present the final results.

After you click VIEW, you will see an execution status bar show up directly beneath the report definition with a running time and a CANCEL button. The timer lets you know how long the query (report) has been running, and the CANCEL button allows you to kill the process mid-stream.

 

 

Many if not most queries will return results in a matter of seconds. In general, the larger the result set you want to bring back, the longer the query will take to execute on the server and then bring the results back over your Internet connection to your computer. Because the results need to travel over the Internet, your connection speed will influence how long the results take to come back.

When your report has finished executing on the server and the results have appeared on the screen, the status bar will update with the following:

The total execution time and the total number of rows in the results table are displayed at the right. You will also now have the option to save your report by clicking on the SAVE button. Saving is discussed in a later section.
